summary: The document is a memorandum from the FBI to the Director, dated December 23, 1964, concerning relations with the Secret Service and threats against the President. It outlines a review conducted in Switzerland and Austria for potential threats to the President, with no individuals identified as such. Discreet inquiries with various sources, including the Consular Section and covert CIA offices, also found no threats. Notably, Paul George Anderson, also known as IS-X, was identified as a person of interest to the Secret Service, primarily due to his frequent travels to Hungary, despite not residing in the reviewed territories.
key_findings: No individuals in Switzerland or Austria were identified as potential threats to the President.
Discreet inquiries with multiple sources confirmed no knowledge of such threats.
Paul George Anderson, aka IS-X, was noted as a person of interest to the Secret Service, frequently traveling to Hungary.
